name: BEST WESTERN PLUS at Historic Concord

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Consistently clean, welcoming, best location, best cookies, great breakfast.
reviews.title: Best Western is the "best"

reviews.text: We spent three nights here-- from June 9 - June 12, 2011, getting together with family. First, the positives: very nice reception staff (with fresh cookies!); nice little gym with an elliptical, a treadmill and a weight machine, updated rooms with good amenities, and a decent, free breakfast.
reviews.title: Good, but no elevator!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative is that the breakfast room is on the second floor, and since my Dad uses a walker, he could not join us for breakfast. They will bring breakfast to your room, but it just isn't the same as getting together with everyone.
reviews.title: Great value, good features

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almost all good all around - only negative is walls do little to stop noise from other rooms. People next door were talking, admittedly quite loudly, and even the TV didn't drown them out. A call to the front desk was needed, the staff notified the people and they quieted down, so that was promptly and well handled. But nothing stopped the very loud water pipe issue that was an annoyance. Loved the free breakfast buffet which was extensive and excellent.
reviews.title: Pure awesomeness ... cleanliness and helpfulness in all areas

reviews.text: I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Very clean. Totally non-smoking. The Harvest Room used for the continental breaksfast was extremely clean and well-kept. The breakfast was good as well. Coffee could be a bit better. Otherwise, a good find.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience both times

reviews.text: This is a fine place to stay while in Concord, MA. It is well-run, well-maintained and comfortable motel. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, and the Italian restaurant across the parking lot is fabulous, a bit pricy, but the food and service is super.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: My wife and I were impessed with the overall experience of this facility. The staff was very friendly and at check in gave us area maps and dining information without us having to ask. The facility had been recently up dated and was very comfortable with class. We had a room with a kingsize bed and balconey for a very reasonable price. A better than average breakfast was included. The location is very convenient for visiting the attractions of Concord and Lexington. I would highly recommend this facility.
reviews.title: Nice Stay - Friendly Staff and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful front desk staff (nice cookies when we checked in were a welcome surprise). Housekeeping staff and breakfast room staff were also very friendly. Stayed in a two double bed room with our teenage daughter with a balcony overlooking the pool. Room was spacious with updated bathroom. The pool was nice after walking each day at the nearby national parks and Concord town center.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location

reviews.text: There is no elevator - which the front desk told us when determing our room assignment. It wasn't a problem for us but could see where that might be a concern for others. The beds were ok for us but folks used to a firmer mattress might be disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent Value West of Boston

reviews.text: If you're traveling to visit the Concord/Lexington area, this is a fine place to stay, but it is a pretty average motor hotel in general.
reviews.title: Fine for a night's sleep in the area.

reviews.text: Room: The room was dated but very clean and well-maintained. The beds were comfortable and there wasn't any noise from other guests.
reviews.title: Quick Trip

reviews.text: Bathroom: Clean and also well-maintained. Again, nothing special here, but no complaints.
reviews.title: Friendly and welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property: Just outside the Concord center on a main road with food options nearby. Lots of parking. The pool is small and has limited hours. The exercise room was nice and there were several of us in there in the morning taking advantage of it.
reviews.title: An impressive hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other: The wifi signal was strong. The breakfast area had the usual self-serve items, but was kept well-stocked and had plenty of seating. The check-in folks were friendly and the staff in general greeted us throughout the property.
reviews.title: Wonderful value and superb staff.

reviews.text: An excellent choice! I always stay here when I travel for business. The rooms are clean and updated, as are the granite countered bathrooms. Exercise facility is fully equipped and the breakfast is bountiful. Staff are always courteous and go out of their way to be helpful. And there is a wonderful full service restaurant right next store.
reviews.title: An excellent choice and a great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with every aspect of our stay: the exterior was well-kept and decorated for the season, our room was spotless and very comfortable, the staff was extremely helpful and courteous, and the free breakfast rivaled the buffet breakfast that cost us $15. per person at a pricier hotel the previous morning! We had an outstanding experience there!
reviews.title: Five star service at a three star price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two stories, interior corridors. A useful place to stay without many frills. About one hour by car from the Boston Airport.. Has pool and outdoor patios. The breakfast room is on the second floor and they have no elevator, so breakfast room is not accessible for disabled persons. Would not recommend for anyone who cannot climb stairs, unless they don't care about breakfast..
reviews.title: Convenient to historic Concord and Italian restaurant next door
Clean older motel
reviews.text: We stayed one night on our way to Boston. It was old style but clean. Only negative I have is we booked and confirmed our room months in advance for a patio room and were told they did not have any left at check in??? We got a balcony room with NO view and it was on the second floor with NO elevator. All the desk clerk said was sorry about that. Pizza shop next door and nothing else close by. I would not go there again.

reviews.title: So happy with my stay that I asked to speak with the Manager
reviews.text: I recently had the pleasure of staying in the Best Western in Concord, MA. The hotel was spotless, the staff friendly and helpful. I was so impressed that I spent time with the Manager before checking out to ask her what her secret was. I highly recommend it.

aka: Best Western At Historic Concord Hotel Concord
